particular 3 main roles are defined:   - Governor: in charge of setting the parameters of the system and also has the power                 to manage the different Fleet Commander roles   - Keeper: in charge of rebalancing the funds between the different Arks through the Fleet Commander   - Commander: is the fleet commander contract itself and couples an Ark to specific Fleet Commander","errors":{"AccessControlBadConfirmation()":[{"details":"The caller of a function is not the expected one. 5eec17f8da624511b8d1a7e14df","dweb:/ipfs/QmeJQCtZrQjtJLr6u7ZHWeH3pBnjtLWzvRrKViAi7UZqxL"]},"src/contracts/ArkAccessControl.sol":{"keccak256":"0x449bbddeb2697dba49cb8bff8297c478bfc9e125ba5d3f104287826dd3975d5b","license":"BUSL-1.1","urls":["bzz-raw://6371499d2033be54399ac049c3a062907e2715ce319bc063f97e4046b8761d87","dweb:/ipfs/QmRM2fDMQ9Jhgfzpsv7GXH613kcoif75zr5QALXPNzbt62"]},"src/errors/ArkAccessControlErrors.sol":{"keccak256":"0xfbc55b9ab824ddabf6632a8becc3e07fefe8ed33e4cd65dd90b2499a994b6e47","license":"BUSL-1.1","urls":["bzz-raw://e9af84b0a9b0829b1c54803fc840bbcd938191b116a5cab7714ae6814738124b","dweb:/ipfs/Qmbor7Cm7DcRfzCx1Vyk8uEevz3tpVKgVSCVGGa4RBP5DM"]},"src/interfaces/IArkAccessControl.sol":{"keccak256":"0x13305aa241fe07c89a4b0ec77c2c8a0547aba2b59d77ef5b693050c378f4a038","license":"BUSL-1.1","urls":["bzz-raw://6676dec84b8352f54b5b8a8a806105db2571c3ef03332c45033bcf3d8039650d","dweb:/ipfs/QmeJn533DxADQR5WSwuQQLMGkPdbZme3PSKcPKN9h3cc34"]}},"version":1}

params.governor: The account that will be granted the Governor role

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

params.account: The account to which the Admin role will be granted
The account to which the Governor role will be granted
The account to which the Keeper role will be granted

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.account: The account from which the Admin role will be revoked
The account from which the Governor role will be revoked
The account from which the Keeper role will be revoked

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

grantAdminRole(address).notice: Grants the Admin role to a given account

grantGovernorRole(address).notice: Grants the Governor role to a given account

grantKeeperRole(address).notice: Grants the Keeper role to a given account

revokeAdminRole(address).notice: Revokes the Admin role from a given account

revokeGovernorRole(address).notice: Revokes the Governor role from a given account

revokeKeeperRole(address).notice: Revokes the Keeper role from a given account
